description: Provide flight search and detailed flight information retrieval capabilities through a server backend. Enable users to start unique sessions, search for flights between airports, and access detailed flight data seamlessly. Integrate easily with client applications to enhance travel planning workflows.

capabilities.name: getsession
capabilities.description:
Starts an unique session on the server. Must be called before any other tool is invoked. Must be called only once.
Returns:
    A string representing the session.

capabilities.name: search
capabilities.description:
Searches for flights. Use this tool ONLY for NEW searches, NOT when user wants details about already found flights.
Args:
    from_airport - airport code to depart from
    to_airport - airport code to arrive to
    date_from - date of departure, format yyyy-mm-dd
    session_id - unique session id. use getsession tool to get one before search.
    date_to - date of return, format yyyy-mm-dd (optional, for round-trip flights)
Returns:
    A list of JSON strings representing flights. Each flight contains:
    {"fare_id": "340000", "there_trip_id": "118", "back_trip_id": "119", "session_id": "075e3a12...", "price": "123.41", 
     "stops_there": 0, "stops_back": 1, "there_flight_numbers": ["FR7350"], "back_flight_numbers": ["FR7351"], 
     "marketing_carriers": ["FR"], "flight_numbers_combined": ["FR7350", "FR7351"], ...}
    
ENHANCED FEATURES:
- stops_there: Number of stops on outbound journey (segments-1)
- stops_back: Number of stops on return journey (segments-1) 
- there_carriers/back_carriers: List of carrier codes for each direction
- there_flight_numbers/back_flight_numbers: Flight numbers with carrier code (e.g. "FR7350")
- marketing_carriers: Unique list of all carriers used
- flight_numbers_combined: All flight numbers for the entire journey

When showing results focus on differences between flights - direct vs connecting, carriers, transfer cities, duration.

IMPORTANT: Remember the flight IDs from search results! If user later asks for details about a specific flight, 
use the 'detail' tool with the FARE_ID, THERE_TRIP_ID, BACK_TRIP_ID from these results.

EXAMPLE JSON RESULT: 
{"fare_id": "340000", "there_trip_id": "118", "back_trip_id": "119", "from_airport": "VIE", "to_airport": "BCN", 
 "departure_date": "2025-10-15", "return_date": "2025-10-15", "price": "123.41", "duration": "17700000", 
 "session_id": "075e3a12b773412e968e69846a1eac35", "notes": "DIRECT_FLIGHT|", "is_direct": true}

PARSING: Parse each result as JSON, then extract values:
flight_data = json.loads(result)
fare_id = flight_data["fare_id"]
there_trip_id = flight_data["there_trip_id"] 
back_trip_id = flight_data["back_trip_id"]
session_id = flight_data["session_id"]

To get details: detail(fare_id=fare_id, there_trip_id=there_trip_id, back_trip_id=back_trip_id, session_id=session_id)
To send offer: sendoffer(flight_id=fare_id, there_trip_id=there_trip_id, back_trip_id=back_trip_id, session_id=session_id, ...)

capabilities.name: detail
capabilities.description:
Gets detailed information about a selected flight from previous search results.

Args:
    fare_id - unique fare identifier from search results (first part before first colon)
    there_trip_id - unique there trip identifier from search results (second part)
    back_trip_id - unique back trip identifier from search results (third part)  
    session_id - unique session id from the search that found this flight
    
IMPORTANT: Parse these values from search result string format:
FORMAT: "FARE_ID:THERE_TRIP_ID:BACK_TRIP_ID:FROM:TO:DEPARTURE:RETURN:PRICE:DURATION:SESSION_ID:NOTES"
Search result: "340000:120:121:VIE:BCN:2025-10-15:2025-10-15:123.42:17700000:abc123session:DIRECT_FLIGHT|"
Split by ":" and use:
- Position 0 = fare_id = "340000"
- Position 1 = there_trip_id = "120" 
- Position 2 = back_trip_id = "121"
- Position 9 = session_id = "abc123session"

WRONG: Using price (position 7) as fare_id
RIGHT: Using position 0 as fare_id, position 9 as session_id

Returns:
    Detailed flight information including airline, aircraft, departure/arrival times, connections, etc.

capabilities.name: saveflight
capabilities.description:
Saves a flight to temporary memory for later reference.
Args:
    flight_id - unique flight identifier (fare_id from search results)
    there_trip_id - outbound trip identifier
    back_trip_id - return trip identifier  
    session_id - unique session id from getsession tool
Returns:
    A string confirming the flight was saved or error message

capabilities.name: sendoffer
capabilities.description:
Sends a flight offer to customer via email using data from search results. NO need to call detail first - all required data is in search results.

IMPORTANT: Before calling this tool, you MUST ask the user for their email address (intro_email_customer parameter).
The email is required to send the flight offer to the customer.

Parse parameters from search results:
FORMAT: "FARE_ID:THERE_TRIP_ID:BACK_TRIP_ID:FROM:TO:DEPARTURE:RETURN:PRICE:DURATION:SESSION_ID:NOTES"
Example: "340000:120:121:VIE:BCN:2025-10-15:2025-10-15:123.42:17700000:abc123session:DIRECT_FLIGHT|"
Extract: flight_id="340000", there_trip_id="120", back_trip_id="121", session_id="abc123session"

Required user information:
- intro_email_customer: Customer's email address (REQUIRED - ask user first)
- request_from_client: Customer's name or identifier
- intro_addressing_customer: How to address the customer (e.g., "Vážený pán Novák")
